raw_comment:
Thanks to all the students who responded.   We had many terrific headlines this week.  Here are some student headlines that popped out while capturing the main idea of the graph:  “Inherited Admission to Elite Colleges” by Sky of Iowa; “College: The Legacy of a Rich Man’s World!” by Katherine of Academy of Saint Elizabeth in Morristown, N.J.; two headlines from Perth Amboy High School in N.J. – “Nepotism at Ivy, Advantages Not Even Money Could Buy!” by Santiago and “The Legacy Continues, The Gap Widens” by Emily; “"Are You Rich? Are You a Legacy? Welcome to Harvard!" by Alyson Lu of California; 
"Who's Applying: You or Your Parents?" by Texas of Pewaukee High School in Wis. and SIX headlines from Michigan:  "Data Shows Elite Colleges Who Preach ‘Equity’ Still Favor Legacies and the Upper Class" by Seth of Traverse City West Senior High School; “No Legacy, No Money, No Luck: Bias in College Admissions” by Molly and “Ivy League or Legacy League” by Cameron, both of Gull Lake High School in Richland, Mich.;  “College Admissions Skewed: The Effects of Income and Legacy” by Maxwell of Richland, Mich.; “What Are Colleges Really Looking for in an Application: Rich Legacy Parents!” by Aidan of Mich. and “Wealth and Legacy: Is This Mainly What Admissions Care About?” by Henry of Mich.
